japanese:
（卒業旅行から帰ってきて数日。
　いよいよ上京する日がやってきた）
translation:
(A few days have passed
 since returning from the graduation trip.
 The day to finally head to Tokyo has arrived.)

japanese: ありがとな、見送りに来てくれて。
translation: Thanks for coming to see me off.

japanese:
そりゃ来るでしょ、恋人が上京しちゃう日なんだから。
どんなお仕事よりも優先です。
translation:
Well, of course I would come. It's the day my boyfriend
is heading to Tokyo. You're my priority over any job.

japanese: い、いや、仕事は大事だろ？
translation: N-no, work is important, right?

japanese:
大丈夫。
サボったりしてないし
無理に休んだわけでもないから安心して。
translation:
Don't worry.
I haven't played hooky or forced a vacation,
so you can rest assured.

japanese:
フータロー君、本当に東京へ行っちゃうんだ。
いまになって実感が湧いてきた。
translation:
Futaro-kun,
you're really going to Tokyo.
I'm starting to feel it now.

japanese:
俺はまだ実感がないな。
しばらくはここに立つこともないなんて。
translation:
I still don't feel it.
It's weird to think
that I won't be standing here for a while.

japanese:
ところで、荷物はそれだけ？
少なくない？
translation:
By the way, is this all your luggage?
There's so little of it?

japanese:
さすがにこれだけってことはねぇよ。
他は全部、部屋に送ってある。
translation:
Well, it's not like that's all there is.
I sent the rest to my room.

japanese:
あはは、だよね。
君のことだからありそうと思っちゃって。
translation: Ahaha, I knew it. That's just like you.

japanese:
ねえ、君が住む部屋がどんなところか気になるから、
落ち着いたら写真送ってよ。
translation:
Hey, I'm curious about
what kind of place you're going to live in.
Send me a photo once you're settled in.

japanese: おう。
translation: Yeah.

japanese:
しばらく会えなくなっちゃうけど、
お姉さんがいなくても泣くんじゃないぞ？
translation:
Even though we won't be able
to see each other for a while,
don't cry just because I'm not there for you.

japanese: 泣かねぇよ。
translation: I won't cry. Come on.

japanese:
あ、でも、どうしても泣きたくなったら、
いつでも電話してくれていいからね。
translation:
Ah, but, if you really want to cry,
feel free to call me anytime.

japanese:
だから泣かねぇって。
今生の別れでもあるまいし。
translation:
I said I won't cry.
It's not like it's a final goodbye or anything.

japanese: 本当かなぁ～？
translation: Are you sure?

japanese: しつこいぞ。
translation: You're being persistent.

japanese: （こんな日でも、一花はいつも通りか）
translation:
(Even on a day like this,
 Ichika is acting the same way she always does.)

japanese:
（いや、もしかしたら、
　こいつなりに俺を安心させようと
　振る舞ってくれているのかもしれない）
translation:
(Ah, but maybe,
 she's trying to reassure me in her own way.)

japanese:
まあ、離れてても連絡は取り合えるし、
そこまで寂しくはないか。
translation:
Well, we can still keep in touch even if we're apart,
so it won't be too lonely.

japanese:
ああ。
それに――
translation:
Yeah.
And%p-2;――

japanese:
これを見れば、お前らのことを思い出せるからな。
寂しくなんてならないさ。
translation:
With this, I can remember you guys.
I won't feel lonely.

japanese:
あ！　ミンサー織りのコースター。
持ち歩いてるの？
translation:
Ah! The coaster made from minsa fabric.
Are you carrying it with you?

japanese: さすがに、いつも持ってるわけじゃないが――
translation: Well, I don't always carry it with me, but%p-2;――

japanese:
大事な物だからな。
これだけは自分の手で持っていこうと思ったんだ。
translation:
It's an important thing.
I wanted to give it to you with my
own two hands.

japanese: ちゃんと大切にしてくれてるんだね。
translation: You're taking good care of it, aren't you.

japanese:
お前らとらいはと俺で買った記念品なんだ。
大切にするに決まってるだろ。
translation:
It's a souvenir we bought together, right?
I have to take care of it.

japanese:
私も。
額に入れて飾っておきたいくらい。
translation: Me too. I want to put mine in a frame and display it.

japanese:
おいおい、飾るって。
普段使いできるようにって意味でも
コースターにしたんだからな？
translation:
Hey, what? Display it?
We made it into a coaster because 
we wanted it to be used everyday, right?

japanese: わかってるよ、あくまで気持ちだけね。
translation:
I know, I know. Just making sure you're
taking good care of it.

japanese:
ちゃんと大切に使ってる。
私だけじゃなくて、みんなも。
translation: Not just me, but everyone.

japanese:
記念品選び、最後まで悩んだけど
ちゃんと素敵なものを選べてよかった。
translation:
We struggled to choose a souvenir,
but it was worth it to get something nice.

japanese: ああ、みんなで悩んだ甲斐があった。
translation: Yeah, it was worth all the effort we put in.

japanese:
沖縄の染織物のコースターで、
柄はみんなが好きなものを自由に選ぶ……。
冴えてる閃きだったよ？
translation:
It was a clever idea to choose Okinawan dyed fabric
coasters and let everyone choose their own
patterns... It was a stroke of genius, don't you think?

japanese: ふふん、我ながらいいアイディアだったぜ！
translation:
Hmm, it was a good idea,
even if I do say so myself!

japanese: 結局、君と私は柄もお揃いにしちゃったけどね。
translation:
Ultimately, you and I ended up with matching patterns,
though.

japanese:
ま、まあ、俺と一花が選んだのは
特別な意味が込められてるわけだし……。
translation:
W-well, the pattern that you and I chose
has a special meaning...

japanese: いつの世までも末永く。
translation: That we'll be together forever.

japanese:
そんな意味が込められてるんだよね。
見つけた時、これしかないって思った。
translation:
That's the meaning behind it.
When I found it, I thought there was no other choice.

japanese: 俺もそうだ。
translation: I feel the same way.

japanese:
私たちは、いつだってずっと繋がってる。
いつの世までも。
translation:
You and I, we'll always be connected.
Until for ever and ever.

japanese: ああ、どれだけ離れていてもな。
translation: Yeah. No matter how far apart we are.

japanese:
けどさ、これを並べて使う日も
そう遠くはないからね。
translation:
But, the day when we'll use these together
isn't too far away.

japanese: ……東京で待ってるぞ。
translation: ...I'll be waiting for you in Tokyo.

japanese: うん。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
（こうして一花といるとずっと話していたくなる。
　でも、そうも言ってられない）
translation:
(When I'm with Ichika like this,
 I always want to keep talking.
 But, I can't just keep saying that.)

japanese:
（確かに離れ離れにはなっちまう。
　それでも、俺たちは確かな絆で繋がっているんだ。
　だから――）
translation:
(We may be apart, but we're still connected
 by a strong bond. That's why%p-2;――%p;)

japanese: それじゃ、一花。
translation: Alright, Ichika.

japanese: またな。
translation: See ya.

japanese: うん、またねフータロー君。
translation: Okay. See you, Futaro-kun.
